title: Federal Supervision of Curricula Text-books and Maintenance of Standards of Education Act, 1976
title_en: Federal Supervision of Curricula Text-books and Maintenance of Standards of Education Act, 1976
description: Official consolidated text of Federal Supervision of Curricula Text-books and Maintenance of Standards of Education Act, 1976 (X of 1976) published by The Pakistan Code (Departmental Laws).

provisions.title: Section 1. Short title, extent and commencement
provisions.content:
(1) This Act may be called the Federal
Supervision of Curricula, Text-books and Maintenance of Standards of Education Act, 1976.
(2) It extends to the whole of Pakistan.
(3) It shall come into force at once.

provisions.title: Section 2. Definitions. In this Act, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,
provisions.content:
(a)         “Competent Authority” means an authority appointed as such under section 3;
and
(b)         “institution” means a school, college or university and includes such other
educational establishment as the Federal Government may, by notification in
the official Gazette, specify for the purpose of this clause.

provisions.title: Section 3. Appointment and duties of Competent Authority
provisions.content:
(1) The Federal Government may,
by notification in the official Gazette, appoint one or more Competent Authorities for carrying out
(2) The Competent Authority may, for carrying out the purposes of this Act,—
(a)         prepare or cause to be prepared schemes of studies, curricula, manuscripts of
text-books and schedules or strategy for their introduction in various classes of
an institution in connection with the implementation of the education policy of
the Federal Government;
(b)         approve manuscripts of text-books produced by other agencies before they are
prescribed in various classes of an institution; and

(c)     direct any person or agency in writing to delete, amend or withdraw any
portion, or the whole, of the curriculum, text-book or reference material
prescribed for any class of an institution within a period specified in such
directive.
(3) Action on the directive of the competent Authority under clause (c) of sub-section (2) shall
be taken as soon as possible by the person or agency and an implementation report shall be submitted
to the Competent Authority within such period as may be laid down in the directive.

provisions.title: Section 4. Penalty. If the person, to whom or the person responsible for the conduct of the affairs of
provisions.content:
any agency to which, a directive has been issued under clause (c) of sub-section (2) of section 3
fails to carry it out, he shall be punishable with imprisonment for a term which may extend to one
year and shall also be guilty of gross misconduct; and such agency may be superseded by order of the
authority appointing or constituting it. .

provisions.title: Section 5. Jurisdiction to try offences. No court shall take cognizance of an offence punishable
provisions.content: under this Act except upon a complaint in writing made by the Competent Authority.

provisions.title: Section 6. Indemnity. No suit, prosecution or other legal proceeding shall lie against any person for
provisions.content:
anything which is in good faith done or intended to be done in pursuance of this Act or any rule or
order made thereunder.

provisions.title: Section 7. Power to make rules. The Federal Government may, by notification in the official
provisions.content:
Gazette, make rules for carrying out the purposes of this Act.
